review_title: Too demanding but much cool experience
job_title: Marketing Project Manager in Saint Petersburg, Sankt-Peterburg
cons: too much demand from employees, lack of managerial qualities from team leaders

job_title: Partnership Manager in Saint Petersburg, Sankt-Peterburg
pros:
You can have a lot of responsibility, test your skill and push yourself beyond limits. A lot of nice motivated people work there.
You might get some useful connections.
cons:
Everything depends on how the EB team of your local office manages the work. Mine demanded a lot and didn't give much help and really failed at recruitment which lead to an enormous time needed to be spent on work in AIESEC.
It's a volunteer organization and you don't get salary

review_title: this experience gave me challenging opportunities to explore myself in different fields.
job_title: Vice President for Outgoing Exchanges (MC RUssia) in Moscow, Moskva
pros:
-international environment
-training from AIESEC partner companies
-supportive network and opportunity to get honest feedback while developing in organization
-development of leadership qualities, taking responsibility 
-opportunity to go on internship (volunteer or professional)
cons: -it is non-paid volunteer job, which you usually combine with studies in university or work, which is tough, but it teaches you how to be self-starter and self-motivator
too many hypocrites, don't care about organization's values

pros: It is a good start of career for students, also it's good volunteer experience

review_title: Amazing experience, developed in every way possible
pros: Best people, amazing job, education, fun, impact.
cons: You don't get paid for your work until MC level

pros: best experience for students in leadership development
